thread.title: Borussia Dortmund 1 Hertha Berlin 1 (4-3 pens): Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang struggles as Thomas Tuchel’s side scrape through to German Cup last eight
thread.title_full: Borussia Dortmund 1 Hertha Berlin 1 (4-3 pens): Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang struggles as Thomas Tuchel’s side scrape through to German Cup last eight

author: ashilton
title: Borussia Dortmund 1 Hertha Berlin 1 (4-3 pens): Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang struggles as Thomas Tuchel’s side scrape through to German Cup last eight
text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments PIERRE-EMERICK AUBAMEYANG struggled to live up to his £40million price tag as Dortmund scraped past Hertha Berlin and into the German Cup last eight. 
The Liverpool and Manchester City target missed a host of chances – including one where he dived embarrassingly – before helping Thomas Tuchel’s side to a penalty shootout win. AP:Associated Press 9 Aubameyang and the rest of the Dortmund players celebrate their German Cup win 
Former Chelsea forward Salomon Kalou opened the scoring with a fine volley but turned from hero to villain by missing the final spot-kick after Marco Reus had struck a second-half leveller. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Dortmund news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary. 
A defensive shocker from Dortmund defender Sokratis Papastathopoulos set Vedad Ibisevic through on goal for the game’s first chance but the Bosnia international fired wide. 
And the game’s manic start continued as Aubameyang wasted two glorious opportunities. AP:Associated Press Rune Jarstein goes to ground before Aubameyang dives Reuters Liverpool and Arsenal target Aubameyang struggled at times 10 things you may not know about Manchester City target Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang 
He first tried to round keeper Rune Jarstein only to dive and embarrassingly kick the ball out for a goal kick in the process. 
The Norwegian stopper then pulled off a great stop to deny the Gabon hitman. 
Ibisevic astonishingly headed over from close range before Kalou pounced just before the half-hour mark for the opener. Reuters Kalou (No8) hits the decks after volleying in the opener for Hertha AP:Associated Press Kalou is mobbed after his surprise opener Related stories GLOVES ARE OFF David de Gea and Thibaut Courtois locked in battle to replace Keylor Navas as Real Madrid No1 WE WANT MOUR OF YOU Jose Mourinho will talk with Man Utd at the end of the season over a one-year contract extension hart take Arsenal join the race for £15million Joe Hart as Arsene Wenger eyes up a replacement for Petr Cech CONFIRM OR DENY Max Allegri fuels Arsenal speculation despite Juve GM telling Gunners 'there's no reason to leave' Jack of no clubs Jack Wilshere faces crisis as 'Cherries unlikely to buy him and Arsenal cannot ensure first-team football' NIFTY SHADES OF GRAY Leicester 3 Derby 1 (AET): Demarai Gray sends Foxes to FA Cup fifth round to ease some of the pressure on Claudio Ranieri REDS ALERT Adam Lallana 'set to MISS Liverpool's crucial showdown with Tottenham after not training all week' VAN PARKED Virgil van Dijk set to sensationally snub mega-money move to Prem giants and STAY at Southampton BLOOMING AWFUL BBC pundits slam Leicester and Derby after 18 changes made for dreadful FA Cup showcase DEPAYET GOALS Premier League misfits Dimitri Payet and Memphis Depay score first goals in Ligue 1 READY, STEADY, COOK Man City's kids know how to stick it in the onion bag.. and plenty of other kitchen skills as well HISTORY MAKERS Alaves 1 Celta Vigo 0: Babazorros reach Copa del Rey final for first time in 96-year history after late winner Reuters 9 Aubameyang has a goal ruled out in the second half 
Niklas Stark delivered a pinpoint cross and Kalou acrobatically stretched to reach the ball ahead keeper Roman Buerki. 
Dortmund flew out of the traps after half-time and were soon level through Reus. 
French wonderkid Ousmane Dembele struck the foot of the post and the Germany midfielder swept in from the resulting play for his sixth goal in ten games this season. AP:Associated Press Reus levels by sweeping in early in the second half Getty Images Germany international roars after levelling for Dortmund 
The hosts piled on the pressure, with Aubameyang unfortunate to have a goal chalked off. 
Jarstein denied him with a stunning point-blank save but the keeper was wrongly deemed to have full control of ball when Aubameyang poked in. 
The game then drifted towards extra time and penalties, with Reus furious when he had to hobble off injured. 
Stand-in skipper Sokratis was then sent off in extra time for dissent, but Tuchel's side got over the line as penalties from Aubameyang, Dembele and Gonzalo Castro put them into the next round despite Christian Pulisic's miss. Getty Images Hertha forward Vedad Ibisevic spurned a pair of glorious chances Violence breaks out between Borussia Dortmund and RB Leipzig fans
